question: Give a list of label	Absorption max (nm)	Emission max (nm)	Lifetime (ns)	Quantum yield for the compounds mentioned in the document.
answer:
Plan:
- Search the document for “absorption,” “emission,” “quantum yield,” and “lifetime/ns.”
- Locate any summary table(s) with photophysical data and extract values.

What I found:
- A photophysical summary table (Table 1) lists absorption/emission maxima (solution and film), fluorescence lifetimes, and quantum yields for CzS1 and CzS2.
- Supporting text confirms film PL peaks and measurement methods.

Extracted data (from Table 1 and surrounding text):
- Source: Table 1 image (photophysical properties) and UV–vis/PL discussion
  - Table 1 image: https://storage.treer.ai/images/66bf1cd031ef7e2656a7b3be784695c67fe0f27612f303633ae6848f89720663.jpg
  - UV–vis/PL discussion: absorption/emission in films (chars 21000–22500)
  - Transient decay context (solution, oxygen-free toluene): chars 25850–26650

List of compounds with absorption max (nm), emission max (nm), lifetime (ns), and quantum yield:
- CzS1
  - Absorption max (nm): solution 293, 332, 341; film 293, 346 [Table 1; UV–vis/PL text]
  - Emission max (nm): solution 399; film 428 [Table 1; UV–vis/PL text]
  - Lifetime (ns): 2.55 (measured for solution; transient decays recorded in oxygen-free toluene) [Table 1; transient decay text]
  - Quantum yield: solution ≈1; film 0.98 [Table 1]
- CzS2
  - Absorption max (nm): solution 300, 332; film 304, 347 [Table 1; UV–vis/PL text]
  - Emission max (nm): solution 381, 392; film 416 [Table 1; UV–vis/PL text]
  - Lifetime (ns): 1.51 (measured for solution; transient decays recorded in oxygen-free toluene) [Table 1; transient decay text]
  - Quantum yield: solution ≈1; film 0.79 [Table 1]

Notes:
- Table 1 uses superscripts: a = solution; c = film. τ (ns) is given once per compound and, per the experimental section and transient PL description, corresponds to solution (oxygen-free toluene).
- Film PLQY was measured by integrating sphere; transient decays were characterized with an Edinburgh F900 setup.
